intro: Spachea tricarpa, commonly known as the three-fruited spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia. Its fruits are three-winged capsules that split open to release seeds. Spachea tricarpa is often found in rocky or sandy habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
